info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:52AM CDT until April 13 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT FOR PERRY...VAN BUREN...CONWAY...NORTHWESTERN FAULKNER...NORTHWESTERN SALINE...EAST CENTRAL YELL AND SOUTHEASTERN POPE COUNTIES... At 1152 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jerusalem to 3 miles west of Morrilton to near Williams Junction, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Conway... Morrilton... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Perryville... Greenbrier... Atkins... Pottsville... Wooster... Oppelo... Guy... Damascus... Twin Groves... Menifee... Perry... Adona... Houston... Bethlehem... Sequoya Park... Hill Creek... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 86 and 124. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
